content:
Just got this in a clash and couldn't solve it in time.
Partly because it was shortest mode and I was golfing while solving, but I genuinely found reading the statement most of the challenge.

The musical chairs part is it's own simple clash that would take some getting used to, even when given n and the number of beats. But then having to calculate the beats and understand the values of all the symbols took longer than it should have for me. Long descriptions on tough challenges are a bit of a bind, because player's end up using up to half of their precious solving time on reading and understanding the statement. Fun concept though. :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea for clash of code. Some people will have fun with it :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I added a little more explanation, but it was fun to code.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea
good

For the first test, 2 beats, so people will move twice.
Before the music starts, Player 3 has no chair (he is at x)
After the first beat, Player 2 has no chair (as Player 3 moved at 1, and Player 1 moved at o).
After the second beat, Player 1 has no chair.

Why is the expected output "2"?

Maybe it is the numbering of players that is not explicit enough? Who is player 1? I thought it was the one in position "1", after the X.

Why is it specified "counterclockwise" in the Goal? Has it an impact? Is the numbering of player "counterclockwise" or "clockwise" ?

Goal section
* Please add a full-stop at the end of each sentence.

* Please fix the typo: "rythm" => "rhythm".

Input section
* Please change "Ligne" to "Line" (twice).

* Please format both line numbers in <<bold>>, e.g. <<Line 1>>.

* Please change "len" to "length".

* Please move both inequalities to Constraints section.

Constraints section
* Please move the first constraint to Input section line 1. It is not a constraint; it explains what n represents.

* Please move the second to last constraints to Goal section. They are not constraints; they explain the representation of the notes.

(The inequalities which indicate the boundaries of the variables are the constraints. They show what types of cases the players would expect to find/not to find.)

I'll review this again and may propose further changes, and there are quite a few things to move around as per my comments above.

Thanks.

Thank a lot, this is my first contribution.
Hope I take care of all points.

Hi Arglanir, 
Schema was wrong according to text: numbering of players was clockwise, so 1 was confusing ! I agree with you.
Your suggestion is much more intuitive ! and I like the schema in a counterclockwise way, more logical and explicit with a 1 after the "x=no chair"
So I coded it as a solution and I changed all tests.  
I added especially 2 tests that convinced me:
4 players / 4 beats (a full circle, so same player = 4 is logical)  and 10 players/11 beats (so player '9 = 10 - 1' is a logical solution).
Thank a lot !
Thanks !
Thanks !
Thanks ðŸ˜€

One change would be to simplify the music theory a bit and just make it clear what needs to be done:
{{A}} to {{G}} and {{{}} (rest) are all 1 beat
{{2}} and {{4}} change note length to 2 beats and 4 beats respectively
{{.}} adds a half beat length to a note
{{#}} is a  sharp that has no effect on the length
Yes, I agree, I will remove the rest {
That's a bit simpler, still a lot of reading, but I know it can be hard to simplify something like this once it's made. Thanks for simplifying it a bit.
Does someone knows how to reorder the tests ?
You have to cut and paste manually; there is no built-in reorder function on the website.

No worries!

All sections
* Please format n and s as [[variables]].

Constraints section
* Only the inequalities (3 â‰¤ n â‰¤ 1000 and 1 â‰¤ length(s) â‰¤ 1000) belong to this section. The remaining text should be moved back to Input section. Sorry if you were confused by my previous comment.

Goal section
* Please change "turn" to "move" (turning around chairs seems to suggest they flip them around...).

* Suggest to be clearer and mention that the chairs are arranged in a circle.

* "becomes first" is unclear. Do you mean when the last player moves, he/she moves to the chair where the first player previously stands? I think some rewording is needed.

Thanks.
I tried to reword and I added a model (starting point)
But I was not able to add multiple spaces in Goal textbox as I needed in my schema
Hi Francine, welcome to the wonderful world of creating puzzlesâ€¦ I haven't read and digested everything but if youâ€™re trying to force extra spaces in, you probably want to use monospace
I did it, perfect, thank you !

Goal section
* Suggest to change "around chairs each beat" to "around chairs, one chair per beat" for clarity of the speed.

* Please add a full-stop after "1 to n".

* Suggest to change "The chairs" to "The [[n]] - 1 chairs"

* Suggest to change "their is a whole (missing chair x)" to "there is one spot in the circle where a chair is missing".

* Suggest to change "When" to "Before".

* Suggest to change "stands up at the whole" to "stands where the chair is missing".

* Suggest to change the diagram to the following (more like a circle):

```
  ooo â†–ï¸
 o   o â†–ï¸
o     {{1}} â†–ï¸
o     {{x}} â¬†ï¸
 o   o â†—ï¸
  ooo â†—ï¸
```

Input section
* Please change "consisting of players (chairs is one less)" to "for the number of players".

* Please change "A..G" to "{{A}} to {{G}}" (twice).

* Please fix the typo: optionaly => optionally.

* Please change "half-beat digit {{.}}" to "digits ({{2}} or {{4}}), healf-beat {{.}}"

* Suggest to change "silent" to "rest" (Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music) ).

* Suggest to change "diese" to "sharp" (Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sharp_(music) ).

* Suggest to change "length is 1" to "length is 1 beat".

* Please format "2", "4", ".", "{" and "#" as {{constants}}.

* Please explain what 2 and 4 mean. (Do they change a note's length to 2 beats and 4 beats respectively?).

* Please change "(previous note is 2 or 4, never 1)" to "whose length is 2 or 4, never 1".

* Suggest to change "a silent" to "a rest".

* Suggest to change "equal to a basic note" to "whose length is 1" for clarity.

* Suggest to change "no effect" to "no effect on the length".

Constraints section
* 2nd constraint: Please change 1000 to 100 to better reflect the actual cases being tested.

Thanks again.

Thank a lot. I guess I take care of all your suggestions.
I simplify a little the "." that applies to a note directly. no "previous" note complexity.

Thank you for making the changes. We're getting there. This should be the last round of comments for the time being!

Goal section
* Please delete "(x)".

* Please add, above the diagram, "Below shows how the start of the game looks like. {{1}} and o denote the players who are sitting on chairs, and {{x}} denotes the player who is standing where a chair is missing. As the music plays, the players move in the direction shown by the arrows, and {{x}} will move to {{1}} after the first beat."

Input section
* Please delete "(chairs is one less)".

* Please change "add" to "adds".

Thanks!

Thanks a lot, I can change whatever you want, no problem.
I changed the solution too, It was wrong.

Haha, ok. But beware, I may be wrong sometimes; it's better to double check ðŸ˜‰

Many thanks.
